Headline: Redefining Nutrition To Maximize Human Potential! Be You, Be Wellversed! On a mission to transform 1 billion lives
Comment: It's great to see that your team took the initiative to have a fun and healthy competition without any external incentives. In my experience, when wellness programs are too complicated or forced, they tend to lose their effectiveness. Instead, promoting a healthy lifestyle through regular conversations and small, simple actions can go a long way in creating a culture of wellness. Keep up the great work!

Headline: Finance Expert | Fin-Techie | Founder | Helping Families Recover Wealth Faster
Comment:
Dilip Kumar Have always been a fan of how you folks promote employee physical health. Kudos üëè 

Another thing that can be done: Promote financial hygiene of the employees. Not for returns or savings, too many people are already doing it but for ensuring their existing savings/investments are in order and secured so that the pain the families have to go through while claiming can be reduced.

We are doing a 60-minute session on "Demystifying Inheritance" for corporates/companies.

Probably you do not need us and can do it internally, but your promotion of its importance will be a light bearer for everyone else.

Comment:
Dilip Kumar

I love this approach! 

Making health and fitness a natural part of the workplace culture rather than a one-off event or incentive-driven activity can have a huge impact. 

Encouraging employees to be active and engage in fun, informal challenges like push-up contests fosters a sense of community and makes wellness a regular part of the workday. 

It‚Äôs about creating an environment where well-being is a shared value, not just a box to check.

Headline: Founder at JoiningHands | Family Constellation & Regression Therapist | Building a supportive community for healing & self-discovery
Comment:
Here‚Äôs another thing to try‚Ä¶..

Ask everyone to close their eyes and think of the happiest memory of their life and then ask how it is impacting their today‚Äôs life and thoughts‚Ä¶..


Now repeat the same by asking them to do the same with their worst or most painful memory and how that‚Äôs is impacting their life‚Ä¶. If you see tears or anxiety or sweating then that‚Äôs a sign of their mental health. 

PS: Please do above under a trained therapist
